articles.headline: European Tech Scene Begins to Feel Silicon Valley’s Woes
articles.snippet: As fears grow in the United States, European start-ups and venture capitalists say the problems are starting to spread across the Atlantic.
articles.abstract: As fears grow in the United States, European start-ups and venture capitalists say the problems are starting to spread across the Atlantic.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — At the offices of Deliveroo, a food delivery start-up with headquarters in an upmarket neighborhood here, signs of activity are everywhere. The communal kitchen hums with 20-something developers. A gold-painted scooter, which the co-founder William Shu once used to make deliveries, stands in the center of the office as people bustle about.

articles.headline: Behind Ted Cruz’s Campaign Manager, Scorched Earth and Election Victories
articles.snippet: Jeff Roe, a longtime political operative in local and national races, has steered Mr. Cruz’s onetime long-shot presidential bid into contention.
articles.abstract: Jeff Roe, a longtime political operative in local and national races, has steered Mr. Cruz’s onetime long-shot presidential bid into contention.
articles.lead_paragraph: For weeks, the labels have hung over Ted Cruz’s presidential campaign like dirty laundry: Deceitful. Cynical. Willing to do anything to win.

articles.headline: Questions Linger Over Russia’s Endgame in Syria, Ukraine and Europe
articles.snippet: A partial truce in Syria capped something of a foreign policy trifecta for President Vladimir V. Putin, but his goals are uncertain for all three.
articles.abstract: A partial truce in Syria capped something of a foreign policy trifecta for President Vladimir V. Putin, but his goals are uncertain for all three.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The partial truce that Russia and the United States have thrashed out in Syria capped something of a foreign policy trifecta for President Vladimir V. Putin, with the Kremlin strong-arming itself into a pivotal role in the Middle East, Ukraine floundering and the European Union developing cracks like a badly glazed pot.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Senators Say Obama Supreme Court Pick Will Be Rejected
articles.snippet: With cracks showing in the G.O.P. ranks, the majority leader, Mitch McConnell, showed no sign of relenting.
articles.abstract: With cracks showing in the G.O.P. ranks, the majority leader, Mitch McConnell, showed no sign of relenting.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republican leaders said Tuesday that there would be no confirmation hearings, no vote, not even a courtesy meeting with President Obama’s nominee to replace Justice Antonin Scalia, all but slamming shut any prospects for an election-year Supreme Court confirmation.

articles.headline: Signature Bank Sued Over Connection to Ponzi Scheme
articles.snippet: Investors claim Signature helped a money manager pull off a $66 million fraud by ordering him to shift money around accounts he held at the bank to cover overdrafts.
articles.abstract: Investors claim Signature helped a money manager pull off a $66 million fraud by ordering him to shift money around accounts he held at the bank to cover overdrafts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Signature Bank has been a darling of Wall Street in the 15 years since it opened its first branch in Manhattan.

articles.headline: Nudges Aren’t Enough for Problems Like Retirement Savings
articles.snippet: Ideas drawn from psychology are helping Americans make better economic choices, but they fail to address problems in areas like retirement savings.
articles.abstract: Ideas drawn from psychology are helping Americans make better economic choices, but they fail to address problems in areas like retirement savings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Why don’t Americans save more for old age? Even when their employers promise to match their savings, workers often fail to salt away their earnings for the future, inexplicably leaving money on the table.

articles.headline: Apple Faces U.S. Demand to Unlock 9 More iPhones
articles.snippet: The disclosure seems to bolster the company’s position that cooperating with prosecutors in a California mass shooting case could have a wider effect.
articles.abstract: The disclosure seems to bolster the company’s position that cooperating with prosecutors in a California mass shooting case could have a wider effect.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Justice Department is demanding Apple’s help in unlocking at least nine iPhones nationwide in addition to the phone used by one of the San Bernardino, Calif., attackers.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and Joseph Goldstein

articles.headline: Takata Faked Test Data a Year After Airbag Recalls, Report Says
articles.snippet: A Senate report showed Takata officials presenting falsified test data about the design of a new component, illustrating what investigators called a pattern of deceit.
articles.abstract: A Senate report showed Takata officials presenting falsified test data about the design of a new component, illustrating what investigators called a pattern of deceit.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than a year after defective Takata airbags led to recalls and at least two fatalities, company officials in Japan presented falsified test data about a new component’s design to Honda, their largest customer, according to internal documents.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Abortion Case Seen as a Turning Point for Clinics
articles.snippet: The future of many clinics, across much of the country, could be at stake this spring as the Supreme Court takes up what both sides in the debate describe as a landmark issue.
articles.abstract: The future of many clinics, across much of the country, could be at stake this spring as the Supreme Court takes up what both sides in the debate describe as a landmark issue.
articles.lead_paragraph: MONTGOMERY, Ala. — About 20 women came to the abortion clinic here on a recent morning, hurrying past the shouting protesters as volunteer escorts held up umbrellas to shield their faces.

articles.headline: Crackdowns on Free Speech Rise Across a Europe Wary of Terror
articles.snippet: Spain’s arrests of two puppeteers are the latest in a string of prosecutions fueling a debate on whether freedom of speech is under threat in Europe.
articles.abstract: Spain’s arrests of two puppeteers are the latest in a string of prosecutions fueling a debate on whether freedom of speech is under threat in Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADRID — A puppet show at an open square in Madrid during Carnival festivities this month featured a policeman who tried to entrap a witch. The puppet officer held up a little sign to falsely accuse her, using a play on words that combined Al Qaeda and ETA, the Basque separatist group.

articles.headline: The Apple Case Will Grope Its Way Into Your Future
articles.snippet: In an Internet of Things world, every home appliance could be turned into a listening post. That’s why the Apple case matters.
articles.abstract: In an Internet of Things world, every home appliance could be turned into a listening post. That’s why the Apple case matters.
articles.lead_paragraph: To understand what’s at stake in the battle between Apple and the F.B.I. over cracking open a terrorist’s smartphone, it helps to be able to predict the future of the tech industry.
